metadata.title: CVE-2023-52913 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/i915: Fix potential context UAFsgem_context_register() makes the context visible to userspace, and whichpoint a separate thread can trigger the I915_GEM_CONTEXT_DESTROY ioctl.So we need to ensure that nothing uses the ctx ptr after this.  And weneed to ensure that adding the ctx to the xarray is the *last* thingthat gem_context_register() does with the ctx pointer.[tursulin: Stable and fixes tags add/tidy.](cherry picked from commit bed4b455cf5374e68879be56971c1da563bcd90c)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

No subscription required
